title: SRAI Tutorial Accepted at EuroSciPy 2023!
text: The conference takes place from Monday, August 14, to Friday, August 18, in Basel, Switzerland. We’ll be presenting our tutorial on the first day, Monday, August 14 at 10:30 AM (Europe/Berlin). You can find more information on the conference’s main website and the schedule page. We hope to see you there!

title: Piotr Szymański PhD
text:
He is an alumni of the Top 500 Innovators program at Stanford University, worked in several institutions over the years incl. Hasso Plattner Institute in Potsdam, Josef Stefan Institute in Ljubljana, University of Notre Dame and University of Technology Sydney. He is the author of Scikit-multilearn - a popular python library for multi-label classification, and pqdm - a parallel processing wrapper for tqdm.
Apart from multi-label classification, Piotr published papers concerning urban data, traffic analysis and bridging the gap between ASR and NLP in spoken language understanding systems. In his free time he is an urban activist in Wrocław - chairing the Society of Beautification of the City of Wrocław, and a member of Wrocław city district council of Brochów.
Recently he became a member of the international group which models coronavirus spread: MOCOS, which publishes regular reports about the state of the pandemic in Poland and also analysis of related phenomena.

title: News
text:
SRAI Tutorial Accepted at EuroSciPy 2023!


Introduction to Geospatial Machine Learning with SRAI


We’re delighted to announce that our submission to EuroSciPy 2023 has been accepted! We’ll be presenting a tutorial on geospatial machine learning with SRAI.






Jun 15, 2023


1 min






No matching items

title: Geospatial
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
from srai.utils import geocode_to_region_gdf

gdf = geocode_to_region_gdf("Wrocław, Poland")
gdf.explore()




Make this Notebook Trusted to load map: File -> Trust Notebook
Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis
